QuestionStatement: Which of the following will most likely occur in an economy if more money is demanded than is supplied?
AnswerChoices: The amount of investment spending will increase
Interest rates will increase
The demand curve for money will shift to the left
The demand curve for money will shift to the left
The demand curve for money will shift to the right

QuestionStatement: Which of the following transactions would represent an addition to a nation’s current gross domestic product?
AnswerChoices: Ms. Smith purchases a share of stock in an automobile company
A retailer increases her stock of imported shoes
The government increases its domestic purchases of food for use by the military
A corporation sells shoes from last year’s inventory
A mother sells her car to her daughter

QuestionStatement: An increase in energy costs will most likely cause the price level and real gross domestic product to change in which of the following ways?
AnswerChoices: See above
See above
See above
See above
See above

QuestionStatement: Which of the following arguments is typically associated with classical economists?
AnswerChoices: A market economy is self-correcting and thus will not remain in an recession indefinitely
A market economy has stable prices and thus is usually free from inflation
A market economy requires a strong government to ensure that the market meets the needs of the people
A market economy needs only moderate assistance from the government to avoid an extended recession
A market economy eventually results in monopolies in both the input and output markets

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is true according to the circular flow model?
AnswerChoices: Firms are suppliers in both the product and factor markets
Firms are demanders in the product markets
Households are demanders in both the product and factor markets
Households are demanders in the product markets and suppliers in the factor markets
The government is a demander in the product market only

QuestionStatement: Which of the following will occur if the federal government runs a budget deficit?
AnswerChoices: The expenditure multiplier will increase
The size of the national debt will increase
The economy’s output will decrease
State governments will run a budget surplus to offset the federal deficit
Interest rates will tend to decline

QuestionStatement: According to the Keynesian savings schedule, when aggregate income increases by a given amount, savings will
AnswerChoices: Remain the same
Decrease the amount of the change in income
Increase by the amount of the change in income
Increase by less than the amount of the change in income
Increase by more than the amount of the change in income

QuestionStatement: If on receiving a checking deposit of $300 a bank’s excess reserves increased by $255, the required reserve ratio must be
The Federal Reserve can increase the money supply by
AnswerChoices: Selling gold reserves to the banks
Selling foreign currency holdings
Buying government bonds on the open market
Buying gold from foreign central banks
Borrowing reserves from foreign governments

QuestionStatement: When consumers hold money rather than bonds because they expect the interest rates to increase in the future, they are holding money for which of the following purposes?
AnswerChoices: Transactions
Unforeseen expenditures
Speculation
Illiquidity
Exchange

QuestionStatement: An increase in the money supply is most likely to have which of the following short-run effects on real interest rates and real output?
AnswerChoices: See above
See above
See above
See above
See above

QuestionStatement: In the Keynesian model, an expansionary monetary policy will lead to
AnswerChoices: Lower real interest rates and more investment
Lower real interest rates and lower prices
Higher real interest rates and lower prices
Higher real interest rates and higher real income
Higher nominal interest rates and more investment

QuestionStatement: An inflationary gap can be eliminated by all of the following EXCEPT
AnswerChoices: An increase in personal income taxes
An increase in the money supply
An increase in interest rates
A decrease in government spending
A decrease in net exports

QuestionStatement: A contractionary supply shock would most likely result in
AnswerChoices: An increase in aggregate demand
An increase in national income
An increase in gross domestic product
A decrease in the general price level
A decrease in employment

QuestionStatement: An increase in Japan’s demand for United States goods would cause the value of the dollar to
AnswerChoices: Depreciate because of inflation
Depreciate because the united States would be selling more dollars to Japan
Depreciate because the United States money supply would increase as exports rise
Appreciate because Japan would be buying more United States dollars
Appreciate because Japan would be selling more United States dollars

QuestionStatement: 1.      On the basis of the diagram above showing an economy’s production possibilities curve for two goods, which of the following statements must be true?I.      The opportunity cost of moving from point P to point R is 10 units of YII.      The opportunity cost of moving from point R to point P is 8 units of XIII.      The opportunity cost of moving from point Q to point R is 0 units of Y
AnswerChoices: I only
III only
I and II only
II and III only
I, II, and III

QuestionStatement: If real gross domestic product is increasing at 3 percent per year and nominal gross domestic product is increasing at 7 percent per year, which of the following is necessarily true?
AnswerChoices: Unemployment is increasing
The price level is increasing
Exports exceed imports
The economy is in a recession
The government is running a budget deficit

QuestionStatement: The official unemployment rate is not an accurate indicator of actual unemployment in the economy because
AnswerChoices: Structural unemployment is greater than cyclical unemployment at the going wage rate
Full employment is greater than natural unemployment
The unemployment rate is less than natural unemployment
The official rate does not include persons who have given up looking for work
The official rate does not reflect the number of people receiving unemployment compensation

QuestionStatement: The economy is currently experiencing
AnswerChoices: Inflation
Recession
Expansion
Stagflation
Rapid growth

QuestionStatement: The appropriate monetary policy measure necessary to reach full employment is to increase
AnswerChoices: The money supply
The reserve requirements
The discount rate
Taxes
Exports
